heaviest_rainfall.status: On 09 November 2025, a record rainfall of 47.89mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  24.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 144.8 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 34.3mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: On 09 November 2025, the rain lasted for 144.8 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  47.89mm accumulated and it fell at 24.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm experienced was on 02 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 3 cold snaps, usually there are 3.6 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 0 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (191°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 128.2 mph from 27 January 2026.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: It is currently one of the longest windy periods.  It is the ranked 5th since our records started in 23 September 2024.  There have been 4 consecutive days where it has been windy starting on 02 February 2026.  The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 2585 lux) and cloud levels (up 260 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.2 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 259.9m lower than yesterday, 43.3m lower than the past week, 36.7m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 530m to 1993m and averaged 750.9m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: Low clouds are expected, possibly some fog or persistent clouds.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, the air will feel dry and calm and still conditions are expected. Possible light showers, low clouds are expected, possibly some fog or persistent clouds, and it’s dim outside. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (6.7°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
